characters: THE VIEWFINDER OF A VIDEO CAMERA...
...SEES THE TWO FILTHY BARE FEET HALF-HIDDEN UNDER CLOTHE
I TOLD YOU TO OPEN THIS DOOR, BOY
...WITHOUT NOTICING ALL THE SCRATCHES CLAWED ALONG THE IN
THE KIDS EXPLODING FROM THE SURFACE...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV parks. DANE PAYTON, (17), good-looking kid despit the pissed-off sneer, climbs out of the passenger door, stares at the house as if he’s looking at his own tomb.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Shit. LUCAS PAYTON, (10), eyes wide with excitement, scrambles of the back.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane just said shit. The boys’ Mom, SUSAN, (40), steps out of the driver’s doo

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Don’t say shit, Dane. The words flow without emotion... like Susan’s said it a thousand times before. She wipes her hair from her pretty but tired face. And it’s more than the long drive... Susa is the face of a single mother chasing two boys.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You told us it wasn’t going to be that different than the last place.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: It won’t be once we get our stuff moved in.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (slapping his neck) Except for the bugs, the heat, and the twelve-hundred mile walk to go hang out with my friends.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll make new friends. The bugs and heat... those are just a couple of the southern charms. Lucas grabs the house key from Susan, and charges to the front door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I call biggest room. Susan follows after him. Dane stands there alone... staring... gazing up and down this very quiet street. Thi is a world away from New York.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas is already inside. Susan’s picking up a “Welcome Basket" from outside the door.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: That was nice of someone. Dane approaches, carrying a suitcase and iPod.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What, Aunt Bee bake us a pie? Susan doesn’t bother to respond... doesn’t matter, becaus Dane wasn’t waiting around for her to... he walks inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas stands in the doorway of a large, empty bedroom. Da steps in behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: This is so much cooler than the old place. I can put my bed over there, and desk by the window.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You can put your ass in that little room across the hall. Dane grabs a handful of Lucas’ shirt... tugs him out.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: That one smells like potatoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold your breath. Lucas tries to push his way back into the room, but Dane easily stops him. Lucas knows the battle’s lost, so...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Mom, Dane said ass!

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t say ass, Dane. Dane slams the door... slides down to the floor against i This kid is miserable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No furniture yet... just a few unpacked cardboard boxes scattered about. Dane sits on the floor, eating a slice o pizza out of the delivery box, and TEXTING AWAY on his ce phone. The THUMP of rap music tremors from his iPod. Lucas comes bouncing a basketball into the room.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: There’s a goal in the street. Let’s go play. Dane doesn’t react... just keeps tapping his fingers on t keypad. LUCAS (cont'd) Dane. Still nothing. So Lucas bounces the ball off the top of Dane’s head.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Son of a... Dane jerks his earbuds out. DANE (cont’d) What’s your problem?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Let’s play some ball. Dane snatches the basketball... tosses it away... it roll out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Have fun.  Lucas watches Dane go back to his music and phone, then turns... stomps out... passes Susan in the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I‘1l play with you, Smooch. Lucas shakes his head... continues outside by himself. Su slides down to the floor beside Dane... grabs a slice of pizza, then tugs Dane’s earbud out of one ear. SUSAN (cont'd) It’s a change for Lucas too.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: He’s happy anywhere he’s got a room to watch Spongebob or whatever.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Or for you to spend a little time with him.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Any more time and I’d kill him. Dane grabs another slice and stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Let’s be happy here, okay? Dane fakes a big, pizza-stuffed smile, and walks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moving truck in the driveway. Dane, Lucas and Susan joine in with the MOVERS, hauling furniture and boxes into the house. Dane pulls a CLOWN MASK from a box... slips it on, then l around the truck for Lucas to see. Lucas CRIES OUT... stumbles back through the boxes... falls to the yard.

dialogues.speaker: MOM
dialogues.text: Susan snatches the mask off Dane’s laughing face.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Why did you bring this?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (off Lucas) One guess. The little clown freak.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut up.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (mocking) Mom, Lucas just said shut up. Susan shoves the mask in her pocket.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You two are embarrassing yourselves in front of our new neighbor. Dane and Lucas glance beside them, to JULIE CAMPBELL, (17 southern small town Avril Lavigne, sitting on her front porch, stealing glances from the book in her lap. SUSAN (cont'd) (playfully nudges Dane) Beats old Mr. Hyatt hacking up phlegm from next door, huh? Dane ignores Susan... grabs a box... a BIG BOX, now that got an audience. He starts toward the house... glances ov and makes eye contact with Julie. He nods, she smiles... perfect start. Until...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Dane, where do you want me to put all your Clay Aiken cds? Dane’s face falls... he spins around... sees Lucas grinni Dane’s jaw clenches... he fights the urge to drop the box and go all “big brother” on Lucas. Instead, he just nods him... we’re not done here... then continues inside witho another glance to the smiling Julie.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (laughing) You’re in trouble now.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What’s new. Lucas loads up... starts up the walkway, veering wide to avoid Dane on his way back out. Dane just glares at him.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Take that in the basement, okay, sweetie? Lucas nods... continues inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do you baby him so much?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter, you jealous? Susan playfully pinches Dane’s cheek. Dane pulls away. SUSAN (cont'd) I used to baby you before you got too cool for me. But if you want... Susan goes after Dane again. He dodges behind boxes.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Mom. Cut it out. God.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (tosses a pillow at him) What happened to my little boy? Dane glances over... sees that Julie is gone. So he SMACK Susan over the head with the pillow... there’s still a ki there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas flips on the light at the top of the stairs... bare enough light to see where he’s going, as he carries the b down the bare, scarred, wooden steps. He reaches the cement floor basement... all dust and shad Old tools and paint cans rest on metal shelves... boxes o dusty old notebooks and journals are piled in the corner. rusty freezer chest sits along the wall. Lucas stands at the center of the room, nervously glancin around. AND THEN A FAINT KNOCKING drifts from the back shadows of the room. Lucas squints back toward the sound.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane? The KNOCKING STOPS... the basement goes quiet... then SCRATCHING... FINGERNAILS OVER WOOD... and that’s more th enough for Lucas... he drops the box, and spins for the stairs... and RIGHT INTO A HULKING FIGURE. Lucas CRIES OUT... then realizes it’s just one of the MOV

dialogues.speaker: MOVER
dialogues.text: You okay, buddy? Lucas manages a nod, then throws a last glance across th basement before he tears up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane carries more boxes up the front steps. Lucas charges outside to him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Have you been downstairs yet?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Dude, look out, this crap’s heavy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I heard something in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Probably the ghost of the old lady that lived here. Mom says she hung herself in that potato room you’re sleepin’ in. Lucas’ eyes go wide. Dane moves inside... doesn’t let Luc see his smile. Sometimes it’s fun to be the big brother. Lucas rushes down the walk to Susan.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What happened to the people that lived here before us?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Just moved someplace else I guess.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane said you told him the lady hung herself in my room. Susan looks at Dane, walking back out of the house. He grins... shrugs.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Coulda happened.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: The only people getting hung in that house are you two if you both don’t cut it out. Susan carries a load of boxes past them to the house. Dan laughs at Lucas, who gives him a shove, and stomps off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The windows are dark. No sign of movement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Darker than dark... just shapes mixed with shadows. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas in bed... but he can’t sleep. He shifts... kicks... SNIFFS THE AIR of his potato room... scowls... pulls the blanket up over his nose. And then...

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (soft and gurgling) Lucas. Lucas’ eyes flash open. VOICE (0.S.) (cont'd) Help me, Lucas. Lucas is afraid to breathe... finally rolls slowly over.. ...and sees the SHAPE OF A WOMAN HANGING IN HIS OPEN CLOS DOORWAY... feet swaying in the air. Lucas SCREAMS... hits the light switch beside his bed... .+.the room lights up, and we all see DANE, wearing Susan long coat like a dress, and hanging onto the top of the closet doorway with one hand... swinging... and now LAUGHING... hard. So hard that he drops to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (still laughing) Awesome scream, man... like a little girl’s. Susan comes racing into the room, half-asleep... sees Luc in bed... Dane on the floor in her coat... and her concer instantly turns to anger. She snaps her finger at Dane... points to the hall.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Out. Dane walks out, still laughing.  SUSAN (cont'd) And hang my coat back up. Susan waves for Lucas. SUSAN (cont'd) Come on. Lucas jumps out of bed. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/SUSAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Susan asleep... Lucas curled up beside her, safe and soun

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane’s at the kitchen table, drowsily slurping up cereal. Lucas stands at the counter, gnawing on a still-frozen wa straight out of the box. Susan hurries in, slipping a sweater over her NURSE’S UNIFORM.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Okay, call me if there’s a problem, but I don’t want any problems, so don’t call me. I need this job to go well.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We'll be cool.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Promise me. Both of you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Promise.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Scouts honor.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (kissing Dane on the head) You weren’t a Scout.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I thought about it once though because of the cookies.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (laughing) Those are Girl Scouts, loser. Susan kisses Lucas on the cheek.  10.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No pestering your brother.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Good luck, Mom.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Thanks, sweetie. And you two spend some time together today. Susan hurries out the door. Dane and Lucas just continue eating in silence.

dialogues.speaker: SERIES OF SHOTS
dialogues.text: Lucas walks down the hall... stops in Dane’s doorway... s him on his bed, listening to is iPod. Lucas keeps walking Lucas on his bedroom floor, playing with the hamster. Lucas in the living room, playing Xbox by himself. Dane walking out of the kitchen, eating a sandwich... pas Lucas without a word, as he enters to fix his own lunch. Lucas on his bed, tossing a baseball up toward the ceilin catching it in his glove... tossing it again. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Dane stands at his window, peering outside. Lucas steps i the doorway behind him, baseball glove still on.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Let’s go throw.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Busy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Doin’ what? Dane doesn’t answer. Lucas walks in... looks out the window... and there’s Julie, sunbathing in her back yard. seventeen year-old boy’s dream. But not a ten year-old’s. Lucas grabs Dane’s glove... tri to shove it into his hand. LUCAS (cont'd) C'mon, you can stare at her from outside.  11.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (tosses the glove away) Back off. I don’t feel like it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You never feel like it. Lucas stomps out. Dane doesn’t even notice he’s gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The back door swings open, and here comes Lucas striding INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Dane spots Lucas walking across the yard. Lucas throws a devious grin up at him as he walks toward Julie’s fence. Panic washes over Dane’s face... he knows that look. He t the window, shaking his head at Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Don’t do it. Lucas just keeps grinning... and walking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas reaches the fence... climbs up enough to lean over.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey! Julie raises up... squints over at Lucas... smiles.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hi. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dane drops down to the floor beneath the window.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Shit. He waits as long as he can, then slowly inches up... peek back out the window... ...to Lucas pointing straight up at him, and Julie shield her eyes to get a better view of Dane.  12. Dane drops back down to the floor like a corpse... actual wishes he was dead right now... except he’s got one impor thing to do first. So he charges out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas on the fence, in the middle of his chat with Julie.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane liked it better in Brooklyn. He wishes we hadn’t moved. But I... Suddenly the back door almost flies off its hinges as Dan explodes from the house... races toward Lucas on the fenc LUCAS (cont'd) I gotta go. Lucas leaps off the fence... sprints around the side of t house, with Dane in hot pursuit. LUCAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: She’s not here to save you this time! Lucas races to the SIDE BASEMENT DOOR... barges inside... tries to close it before Dane gets there, but he’s too late... BAM... Dane slams the door open. Lucas dodges aro the shelves... throws an old fishing rod at Dane as he ru DANE (cont'd) WHAT’S YOUR PROBLEM, DICKHEAD?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You shoulda played with me! Dane climbs over an old table to get to Lucas. Lucas back across the basement... into a metal shelf, TIPPING IT OVE Both boys freeze, as they watch the shelf tumble, spewing boxes and paint cans all over the place. A lamp SHATTERS. They stare at the wreckage, the fight suddenly stripped o of them.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Mom is gonna be pissed at you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It was your fault.  13. They start grabbing boxes and cans... cleaning the mess. Dane lifts one end of the metal shelf.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Get that other side. Lucas grips the other edge... they tilt the shelf back upright. And when they do, they both see... ...the WOODEN TRAPDOOR IN THE CEMENT BASEMENT FLOOR. A tw foot square of scarred wood, with TWO PADLOCKS ON EACH SI securing it shut.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What is that? Dane shakes his head, no idea. He reaches down... gives i tug... locked. LUCAS (cont'd) That’s a lotta locks.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Probably gas pipes or something.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Or a treasure maybe. Dane rolls his eyes, then pulls on the door again, just i case. No good. So he stands up... starts searching the ar

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Look for the keys. Lucas digs over the shelves. Dane spots a pair of PRUNING SHEARS... strains to cut through one of the locks. Not ev close. He tosses them away... jerks on the trap door agai

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: They’re not down here. Lucas steps back toward Dane, accidentally kicking one of FALLEN PAINT CANS as he moves... and we all hear the JING OF METAL from inside the can as it rolls. Dane and Lucas look at each other, then scramble after th can. Dane grabs it first... jerks out a RING OF KEYS. The exchange a grin, and Dane goes to work on the locks... searching and matching each key to its own lock... snappi them open one by one, until they’re all clear. The boys stare down at the trap door.  14. LUCAS (cont'd) If there’s treasure, I get half. They grip the handle together... Lucas’ little hand right beside Dane’s larger... pull the wooden door back on its hinges... ...revealing nothing but a SOLID BLACK HOLE. And this isn’t just a shallow niche in the floor... this deep... solid black... like staring into a hole in the universe. LUCAS (cont'd) It’s just a hole. Dane peers into the blackness, trying to get a better vie He reaches his hand in just a few inches, but the darknes swallows it like a black mouth. He jerks it back out.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It’s cold. Dane glances around the basement... spots a flashlight... grabs it, and switches it on. He crawls back to the hole. shines the light down. But again, the darkness overpowers the beam... chokes the life from it only a few feet down.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: How deep do you think it is? Dane lifts a fallen nail from the floor beside them... dr it in. The nail sinks into the black... gone... not a sou The boys exchange a glance. Lucas crawls over the open tr door, dragging a PAINT CAN back across...

dialogues.speaker: OF THE WOODEN DOOR.
dialogues.text: Lucas holds the can above the hole until Dane gives him a nod... he drops it... the can falls... disappears. They w for the clank that never comes.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s a real deep tunnel.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: To where?  15. Dane shakes his head... no idea. Dane aims the flashlight again... they each lean their heads directly over the hol

dialogues.speaker: INSIDE THE HOLE...
dialogues.text: .»..on the brothers’ faces peering in from opposite sides heads joined at the top.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: There’s gotta be a bottom.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hello!

dialogues.speaker: THE BOYS
dialogues.text: »+.asS a grin spreads across Lucas’ face.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: A TALKING SOUTHPARK CARTMAN DOLL...
dialogues.text: ...-the flashlight duct-taped around it, with a LONG STRI tied around his neck like a hangman’s noose. Dane and Lucas kneel beside the hole. Lucas holds the string, easing Cartman and the flashlight into the darkne

dialogues.speaker: CARTMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Screw you guys, I’m going home! The string slides over Lucas’ fingers... Cartman and the light descend further... a few feet down. CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont’d) I would never let a woman kick my ass. If she tries anything, I'd be like... And then the black just swallows Cartman, his voice, the light... everything just vanishes. Lucas quickly pulls the string, and the doll and flashlig appear from the darkness.  16. CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont'd) ...-back in the kitchen and make me some pie! Dane and Lucas exchange a smile. Lucas drops Cartman agai CARTMAN (V.O.) (cont'd) Yes, the fireman is very magical. If you... Then Cartman’s gone again.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: How does it do that? Dane just shakes his head. Then suddenly, Lucas’ HAND JERKS... the string tugs... HARD... like a fish just hit baited hook.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What’d you do?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Nothin’. I think it got caught on something. Lucas winds the string back up... just a frayed end. Cart and the light are gone.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: So you two didn’t kill each other? Lucas and Dane shoot up, startled by the voice... see Jul in the basement door, a long t-shirt that reads, “I’m Not Fairy-Tale Princess. Get Over It", hangs over her bikini. Dane stands up... steps between Julie and the hole.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Not yet.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: She’s Julie. Dane nods hello.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And you’re Dane. The one that hates it here. Dane shoots Lucas a glare.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Do you wanna look at our hole?  17.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry? Dane shoots Lucas a look... idiot.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nothin’. There’s just a hole in the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And that’s what people do for fun in Brooklyn? Julie walks around Dane toward Lucas. JULIE (cont'd) Play around with their holes? But then Julie sees the hole, and this is obviously not a normal hole. JULIE (cont'd) What is that?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (proudly) Our hole. Dane closes the basement door.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We're not sure what it is. Julie squints into the bottom. Lucas pulls another flashlight from a box... hands it to Julie. She shines th flashlight into the black.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: We can’t see the bottom. Julie sticks one of her bare feet down into the darkness, Dane grabs her.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t do that.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s just a crawlspace or something. But then Lucas rolls another paint can into the hole... J watches it vanish without a sound.  18. JULIE (cont'd) That’s really weird.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Dane glances around the basement... spots the OLD FISHING ROD. He lifts it... stretches out the lure-ended line... knots it around the metal handle of another paint can, th holds the can over the hole. Lucas and Julie watch intently, as Dane releases the reel clasp... the can drops... the line WHIZZES OUT... the ree spins like a motor, faster and faster... the fishing line unwinding at a dizzying pace... growing thinner and thinn on the spool... .--and Dane, Lucas and Julie are all just watching the re spin... the line pull, as the weighted can drags it out.. until finally, the last of the fishing line unravels from spool... disappears into the hole.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: O-kay. Lucas has a smile spread across his face.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: This is so cool.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s one of those sinkholes... like in California or wherever when the streets open up and the cars drop into them.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (thinks of something) Hang on. Dane takes off for the stairs. Lucas and Julie look back the hole... exchange a glance, then race after him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Wait up, Dane!

dialogues.speaker: THE VIEWFINDER OF A VIDEO CAMERA...
dialogues.text: ...with Julie’s face filling the frame.  19.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Is it working? And then we see Dane holding the camera. There’s a rope t around it. He SWITCHES ON THE CAMERA LIGHT, then gently lowers the camera down into the depths. And just like with everything else, the blackness swallow the camera. Dane lets the rope slip across his fingers... easing the camera deeper... deeper... until finally, he stops... hol it secure. JULIE (cont'd) What do you think you’re gonna see?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Whatever’s down there. Dane slowly twists the rope, turning the camera in a circ

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: There’s nothing down there. It’s a hole.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s like an underground tomb... the Catacombs or something.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: The Catacombs of Bensonville. I doubt it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I say it’s a treasure. Dane twists and pulls the rope, working to get every angl with the camera.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: That’s good. Let’s go watch it. See what the inside of a hole looks like. Dane nods... pulls the rope up, until the camera reappear out of the hole. He slams the trap door closed, and they charge up the stairs.  20.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie are all squatted on the floor in fr of the television, staring at the black screen. Dane’s go the video camera in his lap... the cables running to the

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I told you. There’s nothing down there. It’s just a hole.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: A hole with no bottom in the basement of a house. How does that make sense? And why are there a buncha locks on it?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: To keep kids like us from fallin’ in? Julie nods to Dane. But then a WHISP OF MOVEMENT on the screen.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Did you see that? Dane rewinds the video... replays it... a BLURRED SHAPE FLASHES PAST. DANE (cont’d) Right there. Dane rewinds... plays... pauses on the dim mass. DANE (cont’d) That’s something.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And anything. Light coming through a crack in the wall. The front door opens behind them... Susan’s home. The kid all jump to their feet, spinning to her... .-.and DON’T SEE THE DIM IMAGE OF A HUMAN FACE APPEAR ON SCREEN, ITS MOUTH STRETCHED OPEN INHUMANLY WIDE.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hey, guys.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mom. We were just watching tv.  21. Behind the kids, the ONSCREEN FACE SEEMS TO TURN TOWARD T VOICES... STARE OUT AT THEM.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: (off the image) Yeah. What is that? The face drifts out of view, before Dane spins back to tu it off... only blackness again.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Some stupid show. We were getting ready to turn it off. And this is Julie... from next door.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hey, Julie. (holds up a bag) I brought plenty of Chinese if you're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thank you, but I better go. My mom’s probably looking for me. (to Dane) I’ll see you later.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah... cool. Julie starts for the door.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Susan) It was nice meeting you.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You too, Julie. Julie leaves. Susan starts for the kitchen. SUSAN (cont'd) So what did you guys do all day?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: We found this sweet... Dane throws his hand over Lucas’ mouth... shakes his head

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Just hung out. How was the new job?  22.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Good. Susan throws a shocked look back at Dane. SUSAN (cont'd) Did you really just ask a question about my life? Wow... a couple days in the South, and look how polite you are. Dane fakes a laugh... they continue into the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TIGHT ON THE TRAP DOOR... the locks resting beside it. Th the door BEGINS TO INCH SLOWLY OPEN. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane in bed, eyes closed... looking asleep, but...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: We could get a ladder and climb down. ...there’s Lucas sprawled under a blanket on the floor, w awake... excited.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: There’s no ladder that long.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Like one of those fire truck ladders. Or we tie a rope around somebody... drop ‘em down there.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We’re not droppin’ anybody in the hole, dude. Now go to sleep. (beat) And remember, don’t tell Mom. It'll just freak her out, and she won’t let us figure out what it is.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What if the guy that lived here before was a bank robber, and he hid like a hundred million dollars down there. We could get it... buy whatever we wanted.  23.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (exhausted) Dude... shut up.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Mom wouldn’t have to work anymore. We could move back to our old house. Dane’s eyes suddenly open... that does sound good.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We’1l check it out again tomorrow. Now go to sleep or go back to your own room. Lucas closes his eyes... smiles at all the possibilities bouncing around in his head. INT. JULIE'S HOUSE/JULIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Julie’s propped up in her bed, listening to her iPod as s reads. And we can hear the music too... until Julie’s lam FLICKERS OFF... her music goes silent. Julie glances around... flicks the lamp switch... taps th iPod... nothing. And then somewhere, a LITTLE GIRL GIGGLES. Julie’s eyes s the room... then from BELOW HER...

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: You can’t find me. Julie stops breathing... sits there frozen... just her ey rolling down to the edge of the bed... toward the floor. holds back as long as she can, then leans over.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .--gliding over the edge of the bed... to the floor... em JULIE SLOWLY LEANS FURTHER... her head almost touching th ground as she stretches to see under the bed... closer... closer... the shadowy boxes and dirty clothes coming into view... ...-when JULIE'S iPOD SUDDENLY BLASTS BACK ON. Julie jerk with a start... rolls off the bed... hits the floor with THUD... the LAMP FLICKERS BACK ON...  24. -..and Julie sees there’s no one under her bed. She rolls her eyes, almost embarrassed, then climbs back

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan, dressed for work, walks toward her car. Dane and Lucas stand at the front door, waving goodbye, and itchin get her out of here so they can slam the door shut, and g down to the hole.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: If there's a problem, the hospital number’s by the phone.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: But you don’t want any problems. Got it.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And there’s plenty of food in the fridge. Make sure you eat some fruit. No more Cool Whip and chocolate sauce.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You told us that already.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Five times. Susan starts to climb in... the boys start to shut the door... until Susan steps back out again.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And be nice to each other.

dialogues.speaker: DANE AND LUCAS
dialogues.text: Promise! Susan waves again... finally backs out of the drive... pu away. The boys stand waving until she disappears, then WHAM... the door SLAMS SHUT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas and Dane rush around the room, grabbing rope... an extra flashlight. And then Dane freezes... because Julie is standing at the back door in her bikini, waving in at him. She cracks the door, and leans in.  25.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Some people are hangin’ out at my place, if you wanna come over? (off Dane’s rope and flashlight) Unless you've got hole business. Dane’s frozen... except for his eyes, bouncing from Julie her bikini to Lucas, already at the basement door, VIOLEN SHAKING HIS HEAD.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (to Lucas) Dude.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane trots out the back door toward Julie’s, wearing shor with a towel tossed over his shoulder. Lucas stands at th door, ready to explode.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: That hole’s not going anywhere.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Neither is she.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Can’t take the chance. And don’t go down there till I get back. Lucas watches Dane jump the fence into Julie’s yard... jo a group of other TEENS. And Lucas is left alone... again. He walks back into the house... slams the door shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From the bottom of the steps, we watch as the basement do drifts open... and there’s Lucas filling the doorway. He stares down the steps, deciding whether to descend or not finally does, pulling the door closed behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas fits the keys into the locks... pops them open... l them off to the side. He grabs the handle of the trap door... hesitates a beat before he lifts it, pulling the square of wood back... revealing that coal black hole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids splashing and playing. Dane and Julie trying to dunk each other under water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas props a hand against the edge, and leans directly o over the hole... gazes down into the emptiness, then lets thick gob of spit fall from his lips. It hits the black and immediately vanishes.

dialogues.speaker: DOWN INSIDE THE HOLE...
dialogues.text: .--looking back up at Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party’s still rocking. Dane and Julie lie side by sid on blankets, soaking up the rays.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas slides down to his stomach... nervously reaches his hand into the darkness of the hole. He senses something a pulls it back out, then builds up his nerve again... stretching deeper... deeper...

dialogues.speaker: DEEP DOWN INSIDE THE HOLE...
dialogues.text: .+..as Lucas’ hand reaches down toward us. Our POV starts gliding up... floating toward Lucas and his hand.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS...
dialogues.text: ...reaching down as far as he can into the hole... just a the UPSTAIRS DOOR SWINGS OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: DANE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Hey, Mucas! Lucas jerks his arm up in a panic... grabs the trap door, eases it back shut. DANE (0.S.) (cont'd) You down there? Lucas darts toward the outside basement door... eases it open, and slips out... just as Dane moves a few steps dow the stairs... peers into the empty basement... sees the closed trap door... walks back up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane rises from the basement, just as Lucas strolls in th front door.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Where’ve you been?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Outside... playin’ basketball.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Well c’mon, we’re gonna go grab some ice cream. Lucas sees Julie waiting at the back door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What about the hole?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We’1l check it out when we get back. Hurry up. Lucas GRUNTS... follows Dane outside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Julie sitting at a table, laughing together as t work on a couple double dip cones. A few tables away, Lucas sits alone, letting his ice crea melt in the sun, as he draws a picture on a napkin...  28. of Dane and Julie, with goofy, oversized lips puckered against each other, and a giant-headed monster standing o them, mouth gaping, ready to swallow them both. As Dane laughs, he glances past Julie... spots something the distance... a FIGURE... too far away to recognize, bu seems to be just watching them. Dane’s smile fades. Julie notices it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What is it? Dane snaps out of his stare... looks at Julie and shakes head... then squints back toward the figure... GONE.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas charges through the fence from Julie’s house, with walking behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hurry! We can mess with it some more before Mom gets home. Dane just keeps striding behind him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas races inside... sees Susan reading on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hey, smooch. Lucas’ shoulders fall. Susan walks to him. SUSAN (cont'd) Don’t act so excited to see me. Dane enters, as Susan plants a kiss on Lucas’ cheek... wi Lucas glaring up at Dane. Dane shrugs. SUSAN (cont'd) What happened to you two?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane made me go get ice cream so he could flirt with his new girlfriend.  29.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We just hung out with Julie for a little while.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: All day. Lucas walks for the stairs... gives the basement door a k as he goes past.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I grabbed a pizza if you’re hungry?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m not. Lucas just disappears up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What’s the matter with him?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. Tired I guess. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - EVENING Lucas falls onto his bed... grabs a HANDHELD VIDEO GAME.. starts tapping the buttons.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and quiet. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas still dressed, asleep on the bed, video game still his hand. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane sleeping... until...

dialogues.speaker: MAN'S VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: (whisper) Boy... Dane’s eyes flash open... dart around.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas.  30. Dane glances around the room... his eyes drift to the closet... the door standing open, revealing all that dark inside. Dane stares at it a beat, then stands... walks ov and closes the door.

dialogues.speaker: THE HALL...
dialogues.text: .»»-on Dane inside the room, pushing the closet door clos as THE FIGURE OF A MAN PASSES DOWN THE HALL... and Dane n saw him. Dane walks away from the closet door... toward the hall.. steps out, and we’re just waiting for whoever that was to grab Dane... but nothing happens. And Dane moves halfway down the down the hall... into the bathroom... to the sink... turns on the water, and sticks head under to gulp it back. He twists the faucet back off the house is eerily silent. Dane walks back out into the hall... down the hallway to room... and again we’re just waiting for that man to leap from the shadows... but no. And Dane moves back into the room. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’ ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dane climbs back into his bed... gets comfortable... then SEES SOMETHING... «..THE CLOSET DOOR IS OPEN AGAIN. Dane stares at it, confused... even a little nervous. He stares at that deep, dark rectangle of black emptiness staring back at him... hiding everything it holds.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas. I know you’re in there. Dane rises out from under the blanket... eases toward the closet... nearer... closer... almost there, as he reaches for the door... gets his hands on it to slam it back clos then...

dialogues.speaker: ...SEES THE TWO FILTHY BARE FEET HALF-HIDDEN UNDER CLOTHE
dialogues.text: Dane’s eyes shoot up... to the SHADOWY FACE PEERING OUT F BEHIND SOME HANGING SHIRTS.  31. DANE (cont’d) Shit! He slams the door... scrambles back, grabbing a BASEBALL from the floor, and flipping on the light. He stares at t closet, heart racing. Suddenly Lucas steps in from the hall.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What’re you doin’? Dane jumps with a start... almost goes all Barry Bonds on Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: There’s somebody in my closet. Now Lucas is scared. But Dane feels braver with Lucas there... leans to the door... to the handle.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Maybe you shouldn’t do that. But Dane is doing that. He grabs the handle... pulls the closet door open... .--and with the light on, we can all see there’s nothing a DEREK JETER CARDBOARD STANDEE peering from behind the clothes. Lucas snorts with laughter... loves finally seei Dane scared. LUCAS (cont'd) (snorts with laughter) Nice call. If you’re too scared, I‘1ll ask him for an autograph for you. Lucas LAUGHS his way out of the room... leaving Dane alon confused. He reaches over... flips off the bedroom light. looks back at the cardboard face... maybe it was just dar Dane closes the door... slides a chair over under the han to keep it closed, then backs his way into bed. He lies there... staring at that closet door. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - DAY Lucas is dressed in a collared shirt, tucked into jeans, Susan hovers over him, quickly brushing his hair. Lucas i not happy.  32.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why do I have to do it today?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Because today’s registration at your school, and because I changed my shift at the hospital to do it. Now hold still, we're late. Susan secures Lucas’ chin to get a better grip. Dane step into the room, in shorts and t-shirt, flipping his phone closed.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why doesn’t Dane have to go?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Because I’m in a school where they don’t make you take naps and drink out of sippy cups.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Neither do we, dickhead.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Hey! (to Dane) I know he didn’t learn that one from Spongebob. (back to Lucas) And Dane’s not going because his registration is next week. (to Dane) What are you doing this morning, besides trying to cause trouble?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Julie’s gonna show me around this ghost town. We're gonna try to see everything there is in less than ten minutes.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Just be back here by four. I have to work tonight. Susan walks past Dane, kissing him on the head as she pas Lucas follows her, and Dane grabs his arm... waits for Su to move out of range, then...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Don’t say anything to Mom about last night.  33. Lucas pulls away from Dane.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Who’s the baby now? Dane makes a move for Lucas, but he hurries after Susan.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan opens the door to leave, and there’s Julie, just ab to ring the bell.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Oh, hey, Julie.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hi, Mrs. Payton.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: We're on our way out, but Dane’s upstairs. (yelling back) Dane, Julie’s here. (to Julie) You guys have fun. Dane comes walking down the stairs behind them, slipping his shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan shoves Lucas into the car, waves back to Dane and J at the front door.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Four o'clock. Don’t be late. Dane waves... got it. They watch Susan pull away... and Lucas hang out the window.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Watch out for Derek Jeter! Lucas ducks back in, laughing.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What’s that mean?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nothing. He’s an idiot. You ready?  34.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Bensonville, here we come. They walk toward the street. EXT. BENSONVILLE/MAIN-STREET -— DAY Mayberry with a facelift. Dane and Julie walk down the sidewalk.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: So did you guys get all moved in?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Unfortunately.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What, you’d rather be back in New Jersey or wherever?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It was Brooklyn actually. Philadelphia, Boston and Queens before that. Maybe Jersey was in there somewhere.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: So do you even bother to unpack the boxes?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Every time. My Mom’s always sure the next move is the last one.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She seems nice.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: She’s cool, I guess. She’s a nurse over at the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What about your Dad?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Not so cool. (beat) He’s been locked up since Lucas was a baby... is supposed to get out soon. I was just a little kid back then, so I’m not worried about him anymore. But my mom’s not real anxious for a reunion. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANE (cont'd) She won’t admit it, but I think that’s why we keep doing the moving thing.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Bensonville’s a great place to hide out. He can’t look someplace nobody even knows exists. And it really isn’t that bad here. I mean school sucks, but it probably sucked in Brooklyn too, right?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Pretty much. Dane notices a COUPLE GIRLS staring at them from across t street.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You guys are like celebrities around here. Most people move out of Bensonville, not into it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Plus you moved into Freaky Franklin’s house. (off Dane’s look) The guy that lived there before you... Ethan Franklin. He was like crazy or something. They ended up dragging him off to the psycho hospital or something.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (rolls his eyes) Home sweet home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas charges through the front door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane! (off the silence)

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Susan walks in behind him.  36.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: He’s probably still out with Julie. He’1l be home soon. Lucas hurries up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas runs to Dane’s doorway... looks in... empty. His bo slumps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas is on the floor playing xbox. Susan is behind him o the phone.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: No, I said to be home by four, not start home then. Just hurry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan hangs up... bends down to kiss Lucas on the head. SUSAN (cont'd) I’ve got to get to work, but Dane’s on his way. Call me if he isn’t here in fifteen minutes. Lucas nods without looking away from the screen. SUSAN (cont'd) I love you, Sweetie.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (in his video game drone) Love you too. Susan hustles for the door.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And don’t stay up too late. I’11 come check on you when I get home. Lucas just nods as he continues playing, doesn’t even not Susan walk out, as his fingers dance over the buttons, un his futuristic soldier dies a bloody alien death onscreen Lucas tosses the controller away... turns the game off. H glances around, already bored. He pulls himself up... sta for the stairs.  37. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - DAY Lucas enters... grabs his pad and pencil, then notices th CLOWN MARIONETTE PROPPED UP ON HIS PILLOW. It’s almost hu looking... round face poking out from under the long, red gold, belled hat. It’s painted eyes stare at Lucas. Lucas returns the stare, nervous at first, then realizing it got there... Dane. He throws an angry glare back out i the hall, and grabs the clown by the arm... jerks it off bed, drags it out the door. The clown’s bells jingle agai the floor. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Lucas shoves the marionette under Dane’s sheets... pulls back to get the full effect of the reveal, then snickers his little trick. He tosses the covers back over the clow starts out, then stops... sees the VIDEO CAMERA on the fl

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark... quiet... until the FLICK OF THE LIGHT SWITCH cast dim glow over the room. Lucas moves down the steps, carrying the camera. He walks past the rusty freezer chest... the shelves of tools... t the trap door. He pulls the trap door open, folding it ba onto the floor... .--and there’s that hole, so black it almost glows. Lucas crouches down beside it.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (into hole) Hello! He waits for his echo, but the hole swallowed it, just li it does everything else. Lucas grabs the flashlight from floor... aims the beam into the center of the black... st doesn’t help. AND THEN A JINGLE... but it’s not coming from the hole, i coming from the back corner of the basement. Lucas’ head shoots up... he squints into the shadows... raises the flashlight... .-».the circle of light rises up the floor... to THE CLOW MARIONETTE sitting in the corner of the basement, staring back at Lucas.  38. Lucas freezes... except for his heart, which is about to right out of his chest. He stares back at the clown, want to run, but also afraid to look away... .»+.SoO Lucas and the clown just hold their gaze on each other... like a bizarre stare contest... eyes locked... neither flinching... -..until THE CLOWN BLINKS. Lucas flies backward... drops the flashlight... it hits t cement floor and rolls into the hole... disappears. Then here comes that clown... CRAWLING OUT OF THE SHADOWS ALL FOURS, like some invisible puppeteer is controlling i limbs. The basement is filled with the TINKLING BELLS. Lucas CRIES OUT... scrambles to his feet... throws anothe glance to the marionette... crawling fast... too fast. Lucas takes off... charges for the steps... races up... stumbles... SLAM... falls... doesn’t want to look back, b we can all hear those BELLS GROWING LOUDER, so Lucas does look... just in time to see the clown starting up the ste after him like some kind of horrible insect. Lucas SCREAMS... crawls up the rest of the stairs... figh with the door handle enough to make us think he might not out, as the marionette scurries up behind him. But then Lucas does get it open... he dives out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas slams the door closed, just as the clown reaches th top step. He takes a step back... eyes the silent door... then watches the DOORKNOB BEGIN TO TURN. Lucas throws his weight against the door, pressing it shu Suddenly a HAND DROPS ONTO LUCAS’ SHOULDER. Lucas SCREAMS spins... right into Dane. Lucas dives against Dane, huggi him... sliding back around behind him.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What’s wrong with you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It came after me.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What?  39.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: That clown doll... the one you tried to scare me with. It’s trying to get up here. Dane’s too confused to even ask, so he reaches for the do LUCAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: WAIT
dialogues.text: Too late... Dane has it swung open... AND THERE’S NO CLOW Lucas peeks out around Dane’s body... squints down the st LUCAS (cont'd) It was right there. It chased me.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: A doll chased you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (nods furiously) The one you put in my bed.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talkin’ about, but I didn’t put any clowns in your bed. I might have if I thought about it, but I didn’t.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It was there.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: On the steps.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: In my bed, then I put it in your bed to scare you, then it was downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Okay, you know what, there’s all kinds of weird crap goin’ on in there... (taps Lucas’ head) ...that I don’t even wanna know about, so whatever. The clown’s gone, so we're cool.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It’s still down there somewhere!  40. Lucas’ head’s about to explode, so Dane just GROANS... st down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas hangs onto the back of Dane’s shirt, as they descen into the basement. They move across the room, with Lucas holding on... spinning around for any sneak attacks from rear. Then Dane sees the open trap door.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You weren’t supposed to keep messing with that.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: And you were supposed to be home before Mom left. Dane glances around... squints into the shadows.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Well there’s no clown, so can we go back up? Lucas points into the dark corner.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It was over there. Lucas shoves Dane toward the corner... follows right behi not letting loose of that handful of shirt. They reach th wall... still nothing.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Maybe it’s one of those man-eating, invisible clown dolls. And then a THUMP... SCRAPE from behind them. They turn... see a LITTLE GIRL, (7), SITTING AT THE BOTTOM OF THE STEP Her back is to them, as she bounces a small ball... THUMP scoops up several jacks... SCRAPE. He long blonde hair ha down over her PINK PARTY DRESS. DANE (cont’d) Who the hell’s that? Lucas just shakes his head. DANE (cont’d) (to the little girl) Hey!  41. No answer... just THUMP... SCRAPE. Dane suddenly looks a little nervous. DANE (cont’d) Is she one of your little friends?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No. Dane watches her drop the ball again... THUMP... SCRAPE.. then starts toward her.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Little girl. The girl doesn’t glance back... doesn’t even alter her rhythm... just keeps playing those jacks... THUMP... SCRAPE... THUMP... SCRAPE. Dane and Lucas move closer to her back... closer... close until they’re standing right over the little girl, as she stares down, playing. DANE (cont’d) Are you lost or something? And then the little girl picks up the last of the jacks.. SCRAPE... then slowly looks up at the boys... and her fac so pale it’s almost blue... her eyes are solid black, and it’s like she is CRYING TEARS OF BLOOD.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: I don’t want to die. Dane scrambles backward, dragging Lucas with him. They bo back against the wall... watch the little girl stand... w slowly up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane? Dane’s too scared to answer... just watches her disappear through the doorway. Then he moves to the bottom of the steps... stretches to see if she’s still there... she isn So the brothers start up. LUCAS (cont'd) Why don’t we just stay down here? Dane keeps moving up... so Lucas does too.
Dane and Lucas lean in the doorway... glance around... no sign of the little girl.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Hey! Nothing. So Dane builds up the nerve to step through. The glance around... see the FRONT DOOR CRACKED OPEN.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Did you close that when you came home?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I don’t remember. The brothers move as one toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas step outside... glance up and down the str She isn’t out here either. But Julie is, reading a magazi on her front porch.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You didn’t see a little girl out here did you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: With blood dripping out of her eyes? Dane elbows Lucas... shut up.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: She had this makeup or something on her face.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Do you know her? Dane shakes his head. Julie tosses the magazine, and skip off the porch. JULIE (cont'd) And she was in your house?  43.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Playing jacks down in the basement.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Jacks? (off their nod) Maybe she knows that other guy... thought he still lived here.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Maybe. Julie reaches them.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Did you ask her?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (nods ) She said she didn’t want to die.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (to Lucas) You don’t have to answer every question.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: That she didn’t want to die?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: That’s what it sounded like. It was hard to hear. And then Julie sees something beyond the boys.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Is that her? Dane and Lucas spin... in time to see the back of the lit girl as she walks down the basement steps. Dane takes off after her, with Lucas and Julie right behi

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Hey, little girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids stampede down the steps... reach the bottom... j in time to see... ...the LITTLE GIRL CRAWLING ON HER STOMACH INTO THE HOLE. HER LEGS DISAPPEARING just before the TRAP DOOR SLAMS SHU

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie can’t move... can barely remember t breathe... just stare at that trap door. Finally, they ease toward it... reach the trap door, exch a “should we” glance before Dane grabs the handle... pull back open... ...and there’s that DEEP, DARK, EMPTY HOLE.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Close it, Dane. Dane just keeps gazing down into the black.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Hello? No answer.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane... please.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: She’s gotta be down there.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Dane.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Close it! Lucas tears the trap door loose from Dane’s grip... slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We all saw that, right?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: If you’re talking about the freaky little girl that just crawled into a bottomless pit under your house... yeah. Dane considers the sound of that... stares down at the tr door, then looks to Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What’d you do with the locks?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I left them right there.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Well they’re not here now.  45. They do a quick search... no luck.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Maybe she took them.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Why would she have taken locks?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: So we couldn’t keep her down there anymore. They exchange another creeped-out glance.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Or maybe it wasn’t her that took them. Maybe it was the man last night... or the clown.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hang on. What man... what clown?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nothin’. (beat) What kinda hole is this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Dane, Lucas and Julie sitting at the bottom of the st their backs against the wall, staring at that hole. Lucas between Dane and Julie, wearing a CATCHER’S MASK and hold Dane’s baseball bat. Dane has a paintball helmet on, with the paintball gun across his lap, and Julie holds a KITCH KNIFE in one hand and pointed MEAT THERMOMETER in the oth

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s the gateway to hell. Like a secret passage for dead people.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why would that little girl be... (thinking of a way to say hell) ...down there?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Did you check out those eyes? Black... dripping blood. And she did look completely dead.  46.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s a gateway to hell.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dolls don’t go to... Lucas mouths the word to Dane without actually saying it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Maybe the guy that owned the doll was like some puppet master serial killer... he goes, the clown goes too. Package deal.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Could be a wormhole.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: A what?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Like a door between different universes.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It’s not a wormhole. And you need to stop reading so much. You're turnin’ into a little geek. The O.S. DOORBELL RINGS upstairs. They all give a little jump. Then... DANE (cont’d) Pizza guy. Dane shoves some bills into Lucas’ palm. Lucas throws the back.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m not going up there. Dane looks to Julie... she shakes her head. Dane rolls hi eyes... throws a glance up the stairs, then takes off, gu ready to fire. Lucas and Julie keep their eyes locked on that hole... until Lucas glances to the meat thermometer. LUCAS (cont'd) I wonder what temperature that little girl is. She looked cold.  47.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The PIZZA GUY stands at the front door. The door swings o and there’s Dane, in full paintball gear. The Pizza Guy j looks him. Dane makes a quick exchange... cash for pizza.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Thanks, dude. And just like that, the door swings shut in the Pizza Guy face. He stands there a beat before walking back to his c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane hurries back down the steps with the pizza.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Anything? Lucas and Julie shake their heads... grab a slice each.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: When’s Mom get home?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Not till midnight.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: We should’ve called her.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It would just freak her out. And if she finds out about this, she'd have us packed up tonight.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Okay with me. And that’s what you want too. Dane doesn’t answer... his eyes dart a quick glance to Julie... he’s not so sure anymore.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Let’s figure out what we’ve got before we tell her anything.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know what you've got. You’ve got a gateway to hell under your house. (takes another bite) And that’s really cool.  48.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The houses are all dark. The street is quiet. A breeze whispers through the trees. EXT. JULIE’S HOUSE/POOL - NIGHT The wind blows an inflatable ball off the pool... it does lonely bounce over the yard... wedges against the fence leading to the Payton house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON THE THREE KIDS... still armed to the teeth, but SOUND ASLEEP at the bottom of the steps. Dane’s slumped o with Lucas leaning against him, and Julie’s head on Lucas shoulder. A FIGURE’S SHADOW FLOATS OVER THEM... just hovers there, until Lucas’ eyes blink open... he looks up... SCREAMS... .--and the others fly up, wide awake, weapons ready. And a survival reflex, Dane SQUEEZES THE TRIGGER... POP... ..-before any of them realize it’s SUSAN standing over them... staring down, totally baffled. The ORANGE PAINTBA STAIN drips down from the ceiling beside her head.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I wouldn’t understand anyway, right? Dane and Lucas shake their heads. Susan throws a glance u at the orange dot, then starts up the steps... never noti the open hole across the room. SUSAN (cont'd) Come up when you’re finished. They wait for her to walk out the door, then...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Whatta we do now?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (off the hole) Lock it up for the night.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You lost the locks, remember?  49. Dane walks to the hole... pulls the trap door closed, the glances around the basement until his eyes settle on the RUSTY OLD CHEST FREEZER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the kids pushing the massive box on top of the trap d And this thing must weigh a ton because they’re using eve ounce of strength they have to inch it across the floor u it’s resting squarely on top of the trap door. Julie hands Dane the knife and meat thermometer.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Don’t explore anymore without me. Julie starts out the door... throws a glance back to Dane JULIE (cont'd) This was fun. Then she’s gone, and Dane’s left with Lucas staring at hi lips puckered, making KISSING NOISES. Dane just shoves Lu away. The boys walk up the steps, Lucas making sure he’s in fro They reach the top of the stairs... CLICK... the basement goes dark, except for the moonlight through the window, making the old metal freezer almost glow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Bright and sunny. Joggers and dog-walkers make their way along the street and sidewalk. Susan walks out of the house... climbs into her car, back out of the drive. She pulls away, WAVING TO JULIE ON HER PORCH, as she leav Julie watches for Susan to disappear around the corner, t leaps off her porch... sprints across the yard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Julie charges through the door... and there are Dane and Lucas standing at the closed basement door, waiting for h  50.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I didn’t think she was ever leaving for work. They throw open the door... charge down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie stampede down the steps... reach th bottom and freeze... ...because the CHEST FREEZER IS STANDING ON ITS END AGAIN THE WALL, like it was just tossed there... AND THE TRAP D SITS UNCOVERED. They all just stare at it, until...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Maybe Mom did it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Like she could just roll that thing around.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Maybe it was Satan tired of you blocking his gateway to hell.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (nods ) I bet Satan’s strong.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) So he moves an old freezer, but can’t figure out how to get a few locks off? I’d expect more skills outta a guy with Lucifer’s rep.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Well somebody moved it. Dane walks over to the freezer... gives it a shove... the metal box just rocks a few inches, but enough that... ...a CRUSHED BEER CAN tumbles off to the floor beside Dan feet. Dane stares at the can a second, then reaches down. picks up the can... sniffs the top. JULIE (cont'd) You guys have a party down here last night?  51. Dane shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I bet Satan drinks a lot too.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You said the dude that used to live here... that they took him to some psycho place. (off Julie’s nod) Is he locked up?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I don’t know.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Where do they keep him?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: The old hospital west of town.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Let’s go see if we can ask him some questions.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (points to the trap door) What about that? They all stare at the trap door a beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE OF THE TRAP DOOR... as Dane HAMMERS NAILS ALL AROUN THE EDGES, sealing it shut. He gives the handle a tug... doesn’t move.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Let’s see how Satan does with nails.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Old is right... and in need of a paint job. A high barbed wire fence surrounds the grounds.  52.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie walk down the hall to the NURSE’S D An OLD NURSE greets them with a big smile.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Hey kids, what can I do for you?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We'd like to talk to... And then Dane realizes he doesn’t know who it is they wan talk to... he throws a panicked glance to Julie.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Ethan Franklin. The nurse’s smile fades.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Ethan?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: If it’s okay. He was my neighbor... we were friends.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I didn’t know that he... I mean, I believe you might be the first visitors Ethan’s had here.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Is he allowed to see people?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Of course. Ethan’s a voluntary. He can see who he pleases... come and go as he likes. (beat) He just likes to stay here.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I think he just feels safer. (to Julie) And what was your name, dear?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Julie Campbell. The nurse points to the VISITORS AREA... tables, chairs, television. A few people mingle in the room.  53.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I‘ll bring Ethan over to you. The nurse walks down the hall. Dane, Lucas and Julie walk a table... squeeze into the chairs on one side.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What do we say when he gets here?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We ask him about the hole.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Just like that?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Let’s ask him if it’s a worm hole to another universe.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You know what, just don’t talk. We don’t want the freak to think he’s trapped inside some kindergarten Star Wars convention. They see the nurse step out of a room, leading ETHAN FRANKLIN, (50's), t-shirt and sweat pants hanging on his thin frame... long, gray-streaked hair falling over his g face. His fingers twitch in non-stop motion against the sides of his legs. DANE (cont’d) This guy’s not gonna try to eat our livers or anything is he? Lucas’ eyes widen... eat what?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: How should I know? All I ever did was stare at him from across the fence.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Hope he doesn’t remember that part. Ethan hasn’t looked up... head tilted to one side, eyes locked on his own BARE FEET. And now Dane is staring at t too, as the nurse guides Ethan to the table.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Here’s your friend Julie, Ethan. Do you remember her? Ethan doesn’t answer... just keeps staring at those feet.  54. NURSE (cont’d) (to Julie) He hasn’t talked much since he’s been here. The Nurse eases Ethan into the chair across from them. NURSE (cont’d) But good luck. And just let me know if you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Thank you. The nurse walks away. The kids all just stare at Ethan... his knee trembling wildly. Dane gives Julie an elbow. JULIE (cont'd) Hi, Mr. Franklin. I’m Julie Campbell... I used to live beside you. Ethan doesn’t react... just keeps twitching and trembling

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (whispers to Julie) Did he always look like this? Julie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We're sorry to bother you, but we wanted to ask you about your old house.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: My brother and I live in it now. (beat) We found that trapdoor... in the basement. Suddenly Ethan’s body goes completely still. The kids exchange glances... they just made a connection.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: We're trying to find out where it leads. Ethan doesn’t answer. JULIE (cont'd) Mr. Franklin?  55.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We just want to...

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: The darkness. Now the kids are as still as Ethan. Then...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What does that mean? Is it hell? Is that where the hole leads? Suddenly Ethan’s head flies up... hand shoots out, grabbi Dane by the arm. Ethan’s eyes burn into Dane's.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: You didn’t take the locks off? And now it’s Dane’s turn to be unable to speak. ETHAN (cont'd) (deathly serious) Tell me you didn’t take the locks off. The kids don’t tell Ethan that... so he knows the truth. Suddenly he swings his hand down... knocking some invisib object off his leg. ETHAN (cont'd) Why would you do that?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We didn’t know. Ethan stands... starts backing away from them... back to safety of his own room. His eyes dart around, searching f something the rest of us can’t see. DANE (cont’d) What is it?

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: The darkness knows you.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Knows us? I don’t understand. Did you make it... did you make the hole? Ethan just stares at them... shakes his head.  56.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: It’s been there since the world’s first scream. And then Ethan turns... the kids just watch him twitch hi way back down the hall. His door slams shut.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: He doesn’t like that hole.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And it doesn’t sound like he made it either.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: So we need to find out who did. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Julie’s on the phone. Lucas is on Dane’s bed, playing tha handheld game, and Dane’s sitting at the desk, staring at Derek Jeter.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (into phone) No way, really? Are you sure? Then Dane notices something... TWO GREASE-COVERED WORK BO sitting outside the closet. He stares at them a beat, the walks over... picks one up... looks it over, then...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (to Lucas) Did you put these here. Lucas glances up from the game... shakes his head. Dane looks back to the boot... the FOOTPRINT STAIN on the floo He carries the boots out... lays them in the hall.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Okay, thanks, Dad. Julie flips her phone closed. JULIE (cont'd) He said there was a woman that lived there before Ethan Franklin.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Let’s go talk to her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Can't.  57. Julie leans over, cupping both of Lucas’ ears. JULIE (cont'd) (whispers) She went crazy... killed herself in your kitchen. Julie releases Lucas’ ears, just as...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Killed herself? Now Lucas heard... MOANS.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (off Lucas, to Dane) Nice.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: When was this?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Like before I was born. And then a couple different families moved in, but my Dad said they only stayed for a couple weeks... he never really met them. I think he said they both ran off in the middle of the night... left all their stuff in here. Never came back for it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: So none of them made that hole.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: The world’s first scream. (off their looks) He said it had been down there since then. When was that? Dane and Julie exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: A long time ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Susan sit around the table, eating dinner The only sound is the boys’ chewing.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You guys are quiet tonight.  58. Dane shrugs. Lucas sees it works for Dane, so he shrugs t SUSAN (cont'd) Well I guess that means I have to talk. (beat) How would you two feel about having the house to yourselves for a couple days?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Bad. Dane shoots Lucas a hard glance.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Well I got a call today... there’s a meeting I’m supposed to go to... out of town.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What kinda meeting?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: The mother kind.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why can’t we come?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Because it’s one of those grown-up things, and it’1ll be boring, and you'll have more fun here. And I need somebody to keep an eye on the house.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I don’t wanna keep an eye on it. There’s a ho... ANGLE ON DANE’S FOOT UNDER THE TABLE... ..-KICKING LUCAS’ LEG. LUCAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What’s wrong?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nothing. We'll be fine if you need to go.  59.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You'll take care of each other for me?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. Lucas doesn’t answer... just scowls at Dane.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: And you'll miss me, right? Lucas nods... alot. SUSAN (cont'd) Okay then. That’s that. They continue eating.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark. Everyone’s asleep... or should be. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane awake in bed. Lucas on the floor beside him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I don’t want her to leave us here.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: There’s nothing to be scared of.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You're not scared? Dane notices something on the floor... the SQUARE WINDOW LIGHT where the moon shines through the window. But the image on the floor has LINES STRETCHED OVER THE SQUARE... like bars. Dane looks from the floor to the window... no lines. He stands... moves to the window. LUCAS (cont'd) What are you doin’? Dane doesn’t answer... just waves his hand past the windo and watching his shadow on the floor... of the hand passi over the bars.  60. Dane squints out the window... can’t find what’s causing lines. Finally, he just pulls the curtains closed... the square of light disappears. He climbs back in bed. LUCAS (cont'd) So you’re not scared?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: No. We nailed it shut. No way anything's coming out of there.

dialogues.speaker: THE TRAP DOOR...
dialogues.text: .--and the NAILS TWISTING UP OUT OF THE WOOD... falling t the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DOG stands at the WATER DRAIN in the curb of the street clawing at the grate... GROWLING at something deep inside

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lights flicker from a few windows. INT. BENSONVILLE MENTAL HOSPITAL/ETHAN’S ROOM - NIGHT Dark. Ethan sits on the edge of his bed, staring at the sliver of light seeping in under the door. And then a thin shape appears from beneath the door... a SNAKE slithering across the floor. And then ANOTHER SNAKE... from the air vent on the wall.. ...a THICK GREEN SNAKE curls in from the bathroom... -..another crawls out of the sink faucet. Ethan watches them slide toward him.

dialogues.speaker: ETHAN
dialogues.text: I knew you’d come. Then Ethan looks above him... to the CEILING TILES BOWING UNDER SOME HEAVY WEIGHT... .--he closes his eyes...  61. .+.-jJust as the tiles break away, and a MASS OF SNAKES P DOWN OVER HIM LIKE RAIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Susan stand outside her SUV. Lucas sits in the passenger seat, defiant. Susan kisses Dane’s cheek.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Be nice to your brother.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: If I have to. Susan fakes a laugh... opens the car door.
