dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan climbs inside.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: So what do you think you’re doing?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Going with you.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: I wish you could. But not this time. Susan pulls Lucas into her arms... squeezes him... kisses him. SUSAN (cont'd) There’s nothing to worry about, okay? Lucas’ eyes roll up to Dane... shaking his head outside. Susan leans Lucas back... looks into his face. SUSAN (cont'd) Okay? Lucas finally nods. SUSAN (cont'd) I love you.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I love you too.  62.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: When I get back we’1l do something special. Promise. Lucas climbs out... walks around beside Dane. Susan backs out of the drive... HONKS her horn, and waves out her win as she pulls away. SUSAN (cont'd) I’ll be home soon. I love you guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas return the wave... watch Susan disappear d the street. They turn... stare at the house a beat before walking inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas sits on the floor, playing Xbox. Dane’s on the couc his eyes locked on the basement door. Lucas sees him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: If you go down there, I’m calling Mom. I’11 tell her everything. Dane pulls his eyes from the door... sees Julie walking toward the back door... entering.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Hey, Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey. Julie walks to Dane... leans close.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (whispers) We need to talk. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - DAY Dane paces the room, as Julie sits at the desk, typing aw on his computer.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: How do you know?  63.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: My Dad was talking to somebody from the hospital. They said the doctors think it was a heart attack.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Then it didn’t have anything to do with the hole. I mean it’s nailed shut... so it was just a coincidence. Julie shrugs... isn’t so sure. Neither is Dane.

dialogues.speaker: THE TELEVISION...
dialogues.text: .-+-and the video game monsters attacking... ...-until Dane’s hand reaches into the frame... turns the television off.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I was almost through the level!

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You can finish it when we get back.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Get back from where? Dane heads out the front door without answering. LUCAS (cont'd) Back from where, Dane? Lucas watches Dane and Julie disappear outside, then thro glance to the basement door... and jumps up... races afte them. EXT. BENSONVILLE/MAIN-STREET -— DAY Julie’s car cruises through town.  INT. JULIE’S CAR - DAY 64. Lucas is in the back seat, gazing out the window. He turns... looks past Julie and Dane... through the windshield... ...to the Bensonville Mental Hospital just ahead.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No way!

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It’s just for a couple minutes.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What if that Ethan guy sees us again?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Trust me, that’s not gonna be a problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie reach the nurse’s desk... and the s Old Nurse sits behind it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We're sorry to bother you, but we came by to see Ethan Franklin the other day.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: I remember.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We heard about what happened. Can you tell us anything else. Did he ever talk about anything with you?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: It’s not really my place to discuss Ethan. And I’m fairly busy right now, so if you’ll excuse me. The Old Nurse turns to walk away, then...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: We live in his old house. And we're scared. Dane nudges Lucas... be quiet. The Nurse stops... looks b at Lucas.  65. INT. BENSONVILLE MENTAL HOSPITAL/ETHAN’S ROOM - DAY The kids watch the Old Nurse rest a box on the desk.

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Ethan didn’t have any family, so I’m sure he wouldn’t mind. This is everything he had. Dane and Julie start digging through the box. NURSE (cont’d) I wasn’t here when they found him, but they said he was just sitting there... on the edge of his bed... stiff as a board. Julie pulls out a PAIR OF OVERSIZED RUBBER GLOVES. NURSE (cont’d) Those were Ethan’s snake gloves.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: He was deathly afraid of snakes. The rare days we could get him outside, he’d put those on with some rubber boots up to his knees.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Did he ever say anything about the darkness?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Sometimes... if he’d get upset. For the first few months he was here, I kept the light on for him at night... I thought he was just afraid of the dark. But then he started turning it off himself. (beat) I don’t think he really wanted to see what was around him. Dane pulls out a SMALL NOTEPAD... flips through the pages some completely colored black... others filled with just CRUDE DESIGNS. But every page is used. NURSE (0.S.) (cont'd) What’s that you’ve got there?  66. Dane spins... sees that the Nurse is talking to Lucas, wh crouched beside the bed. Dane shoves the pad into his pocket. Lucas lifts something up from under the bed... let’s it dangle in the air... .+-.a SNAKE SKIN. NURSE (cont’d) Isn’t that strange.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie hurry down the steps toward Julie’s car.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Why would somebody scared to death of snakes keep a snake skin under his bed? Julie shakes her head... no idea. Then Dane stops walking Lucas and Julie look back at him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Scared to death. (beat) She said they found him just sitting there.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Stiff as a board. I get all stiff when I’m scared. Lucas stiffens up to prove it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: So do I, Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas sits on a tree swing, just staring... thinking. Dan and Julie sit on the back porch.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: So what now?  67. Dane shrugs... pulls out Ethan’s notepad... flips through pages... just a jumble of crude shapes. JULIE (cont'd) You stole that?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I thought there might be something written in here.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: And? Dane shakes his head... flips through the pages for Julie see... some totally blacked out, and others with just cru shapes drawn on the page. JULIE (cont'd) So we know how he spent his time in that room. Julie glances back to Lucas... he looks very scared. JULIE (cont'd) Hey, Lucas, how ‘bout we have a little pool party at my house? Order a pizza... swim... splash your brother.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (to Dane) You up for it?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’ll meet you guys over there. Julie starts across the yard to her house.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (to Lucas) Go get your stuff. Lucas starts toward the back door... hesitates, just star at the house. DANE (cont’d) It’s cool. It’s nailed shut.  68. Lucas finally walks in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas steps inside... stops at the door, his eyes locked the basement door. He takes a couple steps across the roo then sprints past the door... races up the stairs. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - DAY Lucas charges inside... slams the door behind him, lockin it. He backs away from the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: POV FROM UNDER LUCAS’ BED... ...-watching Lucas’ feet slowly back across the room.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: And Lucas... satisfied that nothing’s coming through that door. He turns... starts digging through a dresser drawer

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane still flipping through the notepad. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - DAY Lucas pulls a pair of shorts from the drawer. And then an O.S. JINGLE freezes him... ANOTHER JINGLE... Lucas is afr to turn around.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: POV FROM UNDER LUCAS’ BED... .»..on Lucas just standing there.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Lucas summons the courage to turn...  69. ...looks back across his room... no one’s there. Then his eyes sink to the bed... and what could be underneath. Luc just stares at that dark gap... .+.as the JINGLE RETURNS... louder... just beside Lucas. spins... sees the WIND CHIME HANGING IN HIS OPEN WINDOW.. ..--JINGLING WITH THE SUBTLE BREEZE. Lucas relaxes... carries the shorts toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: POV FROM UNDER LUCAS’ BED... ++.as we watch Lucas walk out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane sits beside the pool, still studying that notepad. Julie’s in swimming, as Lucas bounces on the diving board

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Hey, Dane, watch how big the splash is! Lucas leaps into the pool. Dane never sees the splash. Lucas rises back up to the surface. LUCAS (cont'd) Did you see that?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (without looking up) Sweet splash. Julie climbs out of the pool... flicks a little water on as she passes.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You’re lots of fun. Julie walks out to the end of the diving board. JULIE (cont'd) Watch this one, Lucas. Julie bounces off... hits the water, sending a big splash over Dane.  70.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (protecting the notepad) Hey!

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Stop looking at that thing.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Yeah, come on! Dane shakes the water off the notepad... looks at Julie i the pool... just her face floating above the surface... looking like a mermaid as she spits some water in his direction. And that’s all he needs. Dane tosses the notepad away... runs to the board... leaps off, sending a splash over the pool.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER...
dialogues.text: .»+-as Dane sinks to the bottom... pushes off... rises ba the surface.

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: As Dane bobs up out of the water.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Beat that, losers. Julie leaps on Dane... they wrestle in the water, as Luca climbs out laughing... hurries to the board... bounces as high as he can, then... ...SPLASH... the water covers Dane and Julie. Julie SCREA

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER...
dialogues.text: ...as this time, Lucas sinks... his foot hits the bottom, just beside the drain... he pushes off... starts up. ANGLE ON LUCAS’ LEGS... ++.as a SMALL RED HAND SUDDENLY GRABS LUCAS’ ANKLE. Lucas’ rise jerks to a halt. He looks down...  71. ...and there’s the MARIONETTE CLOWN half out of the open drain... smiling up at Lucas as he grips his leg... gives a tug. Lucas CRIES OUT in the water... the pool floods into his mouth. He starts flailing his arms to get to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: DANE AND JULIE...
dialogues.text: ...-wrestling and playing at the other end of the pool... idea what’s happening below them.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS...
dialogues.text: .-..as he kicks at the clown... claws for the surface. But the Clown holds its grip... starts sinking back into drain, pulling Lucas toward the bottom of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: DANE AND JULIE...
dialogues.text: .-.-Still playing... Dane shoving Julie underwater, then diving away... scrambling out of the pool.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS...
dialogues.text: ...stretching for the surface, but sinking deeper... the Clown disappearing backward into the pool drain... pullin Lucas’ foot in with him.

dialogues.speaker: DANE...
dialogues.text: .+-beside the pool, as Julie splashes him. Then he glance around.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Where'd Lucas go? Julie glances around... no idea.  72.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Did he get out?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas! No answer... and then Dane sees the AIR BUBBLES RISING TO SURFACE. DANE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: SHIT
dialogues.text: Dane dives into the pool.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER...
dialogues.text: .»+-as a panicked Lucas strains to pull his leg out of th drain. Dane swims in beside him... grabs Lucas... starts pulling up... BUT HIS FOOT WON’T COME OUT OF THE DRAIN. Dane dives deeper... starts tugging at Lucas’ foot... .+.-JjJust as Julie appears... wraps her arms around Luca waist to pull him up to the surface. Dane struggles against the drain’s pull... finally Lucas’ foot POPS FREE... ...all three shoot up to the surface.

dialogues.speaker: THE KIDS EXPLODING FROM THE SURFACE...
dialogues.text: ...-Lucas COUGHING and GASPING FOR AIR. Dane and Julie ca him to the side.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: It’s okay... it’s okay.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We’ve got you. They help him up over the edge, and Lucas scrambles out.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: THE CLOWN’S IN THERE!  73.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It’s in the pool! It grabbed my leg! Dane and Julie exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Dude, it was the drain. Your foot just got stuck.

dialogues.speaker: NO
dialogues.text: Dane sinks back under.

dialogues.speaker: UNDERWATER...
dialogues.text: .»+-as Dane scans the bottom of the pool... the open drai

dialogues.speaker: DANE...
dialogues.text: ...rises back up.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: There’s just the drain. The lid came off.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: No... it grabbed me... it pulled me down... wouldn’t let me go. Lucas starts crying... is ready to explode.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (to Julie) I’m gonna take him back over. Dane climbs out... starts leading Lucas back.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I’m sorry, Lucas. Lucas just keeps walking.  74. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane sits at his desk, watching Lucas sleep on the floor. His CELL PHONE BUZZES beside him. He grabs it.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: How is he?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Been asleep since we got over here.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Anything I can do?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We're good. I’m just gonna let him sleep... hang out here with him.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Well call me if you need anything.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Okay. Talk to you later. Dane hangs up... slides over... eases the blanket across Lucas... ...then spots something... on Lucas’ leg... around his ankle... BRUISES... IN THE SHAPE OF SMALL FINGERS. Dane stares at the bruises... runs his finger along them, then freezes... hurries out of the room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane runs down the stairs... to the couch... grabs Ethan’ notepad... starts quickly thumbing through the pages... s on one of the odd designs... and if you turn it to the ri angle, it LOOKS JUST LIKE LUCAS’ BRUISE... «..JUST LIKE FINGERS. Dane flips through more pages, turning the notepad in all directions... begins seeing other images in the shapes... EYE... HAND... what could be a nose. Dane starts tearing the pages out of the pad... laying th on the floor... like he’s laying out a giant puzzle. He starts moving the pages around... trying to connect the pieces.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane on his hands and knees at the center of all the page spread out all around him. Some of the pages fit together... we can make out what lo like a half-circle of black... a SHOE BESIDE THE CIRCLE.. TWO HANDS CLENCHED TOGETHER. And then an O.S. WHISTLING... a light MELODY... Dane look to the sound... it’s coming from the kitchen. Dane listens to it a moment, then stands... eases toward kitchen doorway... the WHISTLING GROWS LOUDER. Dane inches the door open...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane steps into the dark kitchen... flips on the light... WHISTLING IS GONE... .-+-and the kitchen is empty... ...except for a GREASE-STAINED MECHANIC’S SHIRT thrown ov one of the chairs. And Dane’s confused... frightened... like he’s just seen ghost, but it’s only a dirty shirt. Dane spins... charges out of the kitchen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane sprints across the room... up the stairs. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT Dane runs into the room... flips on the light... and ther Lucas still asleep on the floor. Dane throws a glance aro the room, then turns the light back off. He steps inside... closes the door, and climbs up into hi bed... but not to sleep... it’s like a guard keeping watc

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quiet and dark.  76.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dim moonlight glows over Ethan’s scattered pages.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The trap door still swung open, exposing the hole.

dialogues.speaker: THE FLOOR...
dialogues.text: .+.-as TWO DIRTY BARE FEET step into frame... move down t hall. INT. PAYTON HOUSE/DANE’S ROOM - NIGHT ANGLE ON LUCAS... ...-sleeping on the floor... as a SHADOW MOVES OVER HIM. Lucas must have sensed the presence because his eyes fly open... he starts to cry out, then sees it’s Dane standin above him, his finger to his lips.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Someone’s in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas step into Dane’s doorway.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (whispers) Stay here. Dane has the baseball bat again... moving into Lucas’ roo INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - CONTINUOUS Dane flips on the light... glances around... empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And Lucas staring anxiously toward his room. But then a BURST OF LIGHT FROM DOWNSTAIRS... someone just turned on lights.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (whispers) Dane. Dane. But Dane doesn’t hear him. So Lucas eases to the stairs.. peers over the rail to see who’s down there. But his view blocked, so he has to creep down a few steps... ..-and spots a YOUNG COP standing in the center of the li room, LOOKING RIGHT BACK UP AT LUCAS.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: Hey, son. What’s your name? Lucas is afraid to answer... afraid to move. He throws another glance down the hall for Dane... not there, so he looks back to the cop.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: Are you the one that called, Lucas?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (shakes his head) My brother, I think. He said someone was in the house.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG COP
dialogues.text: Did your brother say who it was? Lucas shakes his head. The cop throws another glance arou the room, then pulls a Polaroid from his pocket... starts the stairs to Lucas. YOUNG COP (cont'd) I’ve been looking for this person right here. The young cop reaches Lucas... hands Lucas the photo. Luc looks at it, and fear washes over his face. ANGLE ON THE POLAROID... ...of TWO LITTLE GIRLS... one of them the LITTLE GIRL IN PINK DRESS.  78. YOUNG COP (cont'd) That one on the right. The cop turns to go back down the stairs, and that’s when Lucas sees the BLOODY, GAPING WOUND IN THE COP’S BACK... SHOULD BE DEAD... might be dead. YOUNG COP (cont'd) Do you think that’s who your brother saw? Lucas doesn’t answer... can’t answer... just watches the walk back down the stairs... around the corner. Dane appe behind Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I told you to stay in the room.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: (whispers) He’s down there.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: He gave me this. Lucas holds the Polaroid out to Dane with a trembling han Dane stares at the picture, then moves down the stairs... leans around... sees the YOUNG COP WALK INTO THE BASEMENT Dane follows after him... and Lucas is too afraid to stay there by himself, so he rushes behind Dane... ...and never sees the DARK FIGURE OF A MAN STANDING DOWN HALL BEHIND HIM.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas move slowly down the steps... bend down to peer through the railing... to watch the young cop crawl the hole, disappear head first, just like the little girl The trap door slams shut behind him.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You said the nails would keep it closed. You said they couldn’t come up anymore. Dane stares at all the loose nails scattered around the h Then he looks back to the photograph... the two little gi  79. ANGLE ON THE PHOTOGRAPH... .--and the other little girl... strangely familiar.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Oh, shit. He grabs Lucas’ arm. DANE (cont’d) C'mon. They race up the steps.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. JULIE’S HOUSE/JULIE’S ROOM - NIGHT Julie’s asleep in bed... stirs... rolls over... .--and there’s the LITTLE GIRL standing beside her... tho red tears slipping down her cheeks. Julie jumps back with a start... looks like she’s seen a ghost. She presses herself back against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: I missed you, Julie. (beat) Let’s play. Just like we used to. Julie tries to scream... can’t make her mouth work.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: (softly) Da... daddy.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Don’t let him hear you. He’1l make us go to bed. The Little Girl squats down on the floor... starts playin with the jacks. LITTLE GIRL (cont'd) Why didn’t you help me? Then an 0.S. TAPPING. Julie’s eyes dart to her window... Dane knocking against it... motioning her over. Julie looks back to the Little Girl... crawls down off th end of her bed... backs her way to the window, as the Lit Girl bounces the ball... scoops the jacks.  80. Julie reaches the window... shakily flips the lock... thr it open, as the Little Girl sees her escaping. LITTLE GIRL (cont'd) Don’t go, Julie. The Little Girl rises... starts walking after Julie. And Julie’s crying, as she scrambles out the window, with Dan pulling her. EXT. JULIE’S HOUSE - CONTINUOUS Julie hits the ground beside Dane and Lucas... they race away, as the Little Girl stands at the window, watching them... .»+.a red tear hitting the windowsill with a SPLAT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie charge through the back door... loc behind them. Julie falls against Dane, sobbing.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Who is she?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She can’t be real... she can’t be real.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Julie. Who is she? Julie tries to calm down... to focus.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Annie Binning. We used to play together every day when we were little. But then... Julie can’t finish.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Then?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: She disappeared. Someone took her... a man. (beat) We were outside... and this man... he pulled up in a truck. (MORE)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JULIE (cont'd) He was dressed like a policeman, but I knew he wasn’t one... I'd seen him other days taking pictures of us. But this time he got out and started talking to Annie. Then he took Annie’s hand... (crying) ..-he took her hand and led her back to his truck. And I knew something bad was happening, and I wanted to yell, but I was so scared. I wanted to help her but I couldn't. Dane holds her tighter.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It’s okay. (beat) They found him, didn’t they? They found the man, and they shot him, right? Julie nods, then...

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: How'd you know?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (glances at Lucas) Just guessed. But I think I know why she’s here... why she came back. (off Julie’s look) Because you were so scared. Dane points to Ethan’s hole image on the floor. DANE (cont’d) I think inside the hole is whatever we're afraid of. That’s what Ethan meant by The Darkness... dark thoughts... fears. Remember, he said it knows you. I think he meant it knows what we’re scared of.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I don’t know. But it makes our fears real... brings them to life. For Ethan it was snakes. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANE (cont'd) For Lucas it’s clowns. For you... it’s what happened to your friend.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What about you?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (smiles) I’m not scared of anything. But I still want to find some locks to put on that trap door. INT. JULIE’S GARAGE - NIGHT The kids dig through shelves and tool chests.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Got ‘em. Julie holds up a FEW PADLOCKS WITH THE KEYS STILL IN THEM

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: And we need one more thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas stand against the wall. Julie kneels besid the hole, looking scared out of her mind.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I don’t want to do this.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: It’s the only way. And then we see what Julie’s so scared about... the Littl Girl’s feet appear on the basement steps... make their wa slowly down. Julie’s trembling, as she watches the Little Girl reach t bottom... start walking toward her.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Oh, God. The Little Girl moves closer... closer... and Julie wants run, but she doesn’t... she just stares back at her fear.

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: Do you want to play with me?  83.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Some other time, okay, Annie? The Little Girl nods... reaches out her hand, and strokes Julie’s hair. Julie closes her eyes... quivers at the tou

dialogues.speaker: LITTLE GIRL
dialogues.text: You got bigger, Julie. And then Julie opens her eyes... tears well up in them.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know. I’m sorry. Then Julie takes the Little Girl’s hand... holds it. Does seem scared anymore. Then the Little Girl turns, and crawls headfirst back int the hole... disappears. And as soon as she does, Dane and Lucas leap over... slam trap door closed.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: The locks! Dane looks back to the locks still over on the floor. He darts back for them... ++.just as the TRAP DOOR BURSTS BACK OPEN, AND THE CLOWN MARIONETTE STRETCHES OUT... GRABS LUCAS’ ARM. LUCAS (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: The doll jerks Lucas toward the hole, but Julie grabs Lucas... holds him back, as the Marionette claws and tugs Lucas... its little bells JINGLING AWAY. Dane punches the doll away... it vanishes in the black, t WHAM... slams the trap door back down. The kids frantical snap the locks shut. There’s that 0O.S. CLAWING from unde the door, but it finally stops... everything calms... jus the kids’ heavy breathing, as they stare at that closed t door. Then... LUCAS (cont'd) (to Dane) Told you it was real. Dane nods... he believes.  84.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I know everything’s cool now and all, but... do you guys want to stay at my house tonight? Lucas nods wildly to Dane.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane sits on the couch, staring blankly. Julie’s beside h

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Are you okay? Dane snaps out of his zone... nods his head. JULIE (cont'd) It’s over, right? Nothing to worry about? Dane nods... right.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas, let’s go!

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: I’m getting my stuff! Julie notices the notepad pages scattered on the floor.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Are those Ethan’s pages?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yeah. I don’t know what it’s supposed to be. Julie walks over... takes a page... finds a place for it, then moves another... the dark edges seem to fit.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas sitting on the floor, putting his shoes on. And the TAPPING AT HIS WINDOW. Lucas looks over to the window... nothing there.  85. He goes back to his shoes... MORE TAPPING... his head sna up... still, the window’s empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Julie working together on the puzzle.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Right there. Dane slides a page in... Julie places another beside it.. the image is growing.

dialogues.speaker: CUT TO
dialogues.text: INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Lucas stares at the window another beat, then starts craw over, keeping his head below the window... out of sight. reaches it, then slowly raises up to see outside. Nothing but his own reflection. And then Lucas notices something beyond his face... ...the REFLECTION OF A MONSTROUS MAN STANDING IN THE DOOR BEHIND HIM. Lucas spins... but there’s no man there. Lucas turns back the window... sees just his reflection again... NO MAN. So Lucas turns to walk out, and steps RIGHT INTO THE MAN. huge... long greasy hair... hard face... deep, dark eyes. More monster than man.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: (whispers) Hello, boy. Lucas starts to scream, but the man throws a thick hand o his mouth, muffling Lucas’ cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SMALL SQUARE OF CARPET with black on all sides... until Julie’s hand gently lays another page in the square... filling it in with black...  86. ...and we pull back... but don’t reach the edges of the image, because it’s much bigger than we last saw... cover most of the floor... with Dane and Julie standing over it ...staring down at those sketched designs now pieced together. It’s not completely finished, but it’s clear wh the image is... A PICTURE OF THE HOLE... WITH A MAN HOLDI BOY’S HAND... LEADING HIM DOWN INTO THE BLACKNESS.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Oh, God. Dane takes off... charges up the stairs. DANE (cont’d) Lucas! INT. PAYTON HOUSE/LUCAS’ ROOM - NIGHT Dane rushes into the room... no Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas! Then he sees the GREASY FOOTPRINTS on the floor... leadin back out of the room. Dane steps out... sees that the footprints leave a trail the way down the hall. Julie appears up the stairs.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What’s the matter? Where’s Lucas? Dane takes off down the past Julie.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: My father’s got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane comes barreling down the steps.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas! And there’s that trap door OPEN WIDE... the new locks res on the floor beside it. Julie races down after Dane.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What’s going on?  87.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I brought him here. My father. And now he took Lucas down there.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: What? No... there is no down there. There’s no bottom, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Dane isn’t listening to her... he’s grabbing a rope.. tying it around a pipe on the wall, then wrapping it arou his own waist. JULIE (cont'd) Dane, what are you doing?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I have to get Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Wait. You can’t go in that thing. You don’t even know he’s down there.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yes I do. Then Dane steps into that shimmering darkness... WHOOSH.. vanishes into the black... the rope uncoils... stretches then SNAPS TAUT, bending the pipe.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Dane! But Dane’s long gone.

dialogues.speaker: BLACK...
dialogues.text: .-..end of the universe kind of dark. And it’s completely silent except for Dane’s nervous breaths. We hear some movement, then a LIGHT FLASHES ON... ..-and we see Dane’s standing inside a closet, his hand s on a light switch. The rope is still tied around his waist... stretches up to a BLACK HOLE HIGH ABOVE HIM. The closet’s filled with a little boy’s clothes and toys. Dane glances around, unties the rope, then his eyes settl the closet doorknob... he turns it... pushes the door ope  88. .--inching it wide to reveal a LONG, DARK, NARROW CORRIDO stretching out in front of him... no real light except fo DIM SQUARE at the far end of the hall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane moves through the doorway... just a few steps. And i what little light there is, we can begin to make out the details of the corridor... -..Stone floor... rock walls... and lines of PRISON CELLS EACH SIDE for the length of the passage. Dane looks to th cells beside him... beyond the rusty bars... empty... jus cot in a square room of stone. Dane begins walking down the corridor... toward the light the far end. And the passage seems to stretch forever... like the end is a football field away. Dane throws nervous glances into each cell as he passes.. picking up speed toward the far end... nearing it, and slowing... ..-because he can make out where the light is coming from ANOTHER PRISON CELL... this one glowing with a small lamp and there’s a Man sitting slumped over on the cot... his long, greasy hair hangs down almost to the floor. And we all know who the Man is... so does Dane... that’s he stops outside the cell door... just stares at him... watches as the Man slowly raises his head... rolls those black eyes up toward Dane... and smiles. Dane takes an instinctive step back... but then sees the SHACKLES around the Man’s hands and feet. That gives him courage to...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (soft, frightened) Where’s Lucas? Suddenly the CLANK of a cell door unlocking behind Dane. Dane spins... sees one of the cell doors swinging open. Dane looks at the smiling Man, then begins backing down t hall... nearing the open cell while keeping his eyes on t Man. Finally Dane reaches the open door... looks inside... .--but it isn’t a prison cell anymore... it’s Lucas’ room their house...  89. .+..and LUCAS IS CLIMBING OUT THE WINDOW. DANE (cont’d) Lucas! Lucas doesn’t slow. Dane charges into the room after him. reaches the window and looks out... to their yard below.. .--and Lucas racing across the yard. DANE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane crawls out after him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane scrambles out... starts to jump, then sees that ther NO GROUND BENEATH HIM... just endless darkness. Dane clings to the edge of the window.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: But Lucas is gone... or was never there. Dane climbs back inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane falls back through the window... sees that Lucas’ ro is now just an empty prison cell... same rock floor... st walls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane steps out of the cell... looks back down to where th Man was sitting... ..-but now the COT IS EMPTY... the shackles rest free on floor... the Man is gone. The cell door CLANKS... CREAKS as it drifts open. And the the next cell door swings open... then the one across the hall from that... then the next... and the next... .»+-each door violently crashing open... moving down the toward Dane... and each one faster than the one before... he’s coming for Dane.  90. Dane spins... takes off down the corridor... the cell doo flying open behind him... gaining on him... and it’s a ra to that WHITE CLOSET DOOR at the end of the passage. And it’s like the doors are being blown off their rusty hinges, as they tear wide... crash into the walls... almo even with Dane as he... ...reaches the closet door... charges through.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane slams the door shut... presses himself against it... ready for the attack from the other side... but it never comes. He spots an OLD KEY hanging on the wall beside the door... he grabs it... LOCKS THE DOOR. Dane steps away from the door... turns... sees he’s ina large, vacant room... four walls and a floor... and anoth door on the opposite wall. He hurries to the door... locked. He’s still got the key. slides it into the handle... turns... ...AND THE UNLOCKING CLICK COMES FROM BEHIND DANE. Dane looks back... the other door’s still closed. He turn his door handle... a SQUEAK from the other door. Dane glances back again... stares at the door as he turns knob... .+-and watches the other handle rotate by itself. Dane inches his door open... ...the other door widens as well. Then BAM... something hits Dane’s door from the other sid He shoves it back closed... presses his back against it.. .--and watches as the opposite door shakes back and forth exactly as his. And Dane’s losing his battle... his door’s widening... so the other... .--and finally Dane just takes off... lets his door swing open... .--and when the opposite door opens wide, he sprints thro  gl.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane suddenly slams to the floor with a GASP. He looks ab him... there is no ceiling... just darkness... with a DAR BLACK HOLE shimmering in the middle of it. Dane stands... eases across the room. RAIN and TRAFFIC NO beat against the windows... it feels just like we’re in Queens. A PAIR OF GREASY BOOTS rests beside the back door... a MECHANIC’S SHIRT lays over the chair. FAMILY PHOTOGRAPHS hang on the refrigerator door. We hold one of A YOUNG BOY AND BABY BROTHER, (Dane and Lucas). This is Dane’s old house... where all of Dane’s fears beg Suddenly the end of the rope falls through the black hole drops down beside Dane... just hangs there... ..-with a NOTE tied around the end... “RUN AWAY BOY” Dane looks to the doorway... knows what waits for him on other side. He looks back up to the hole... his escape. B then he tears the note off... crumples it, and tosses it away... walks toward the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane steps through the doorway... into the empty room... a tray of half-eaten food and beer cans sitting in front the television, as a YANKEES GAME plays onscreen. Dane creeps through the room, his eyes searching for Luca

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A room for two boys. A twin bed on one side and crib on t other... each with matching baseball blankets... one Nati League, the other American. Sports posters line the walls another photograph of the YOUNG DANE in his baseball unif with BABY LUCAS sitting in his lap. Dane moves straight for the closet... opens the door, and closet is filled with clothes, toys and junk of a little boy... this is just like the closet where Dane arrived wh he jumped into the hole. And then Lucas steps out from behind the clothes.  92. They see each other... wrap their arms around the other. Dane holds Lucas tight... probably like he hasn’t hugged in years. Dane closes the door behind him, sealing the two boys ins together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane and Lucas slide down to the floor together.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: How'd you know where I was?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Because this is where I always used to hide when I was scared.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You did? (off Dane’s nod) I thought you said you weren't scared of anything. A beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I lied.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: You’re scared of him?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: (nods ) And it’s my fault he brought you here. He’s my fear, not yours.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Then you shouldn’t have come down.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I had to. What would I do up there without you?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What you always do. Play with the older kids.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Listen to me... I know it seems like I’m always gettin’ mad at you, or hangin’ out with other people, but... (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: DANE (cont'd) that’s the thing with brothers... (beat, thinking) ...they’re like old closets. ‘Cause no matter how many new friends you make or new places you go... there’s only one place where you really feel good and safe. (beat) And sometimes you just gotta get scared enough to remember that. Lucas considers all this a moment, then...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: But you still shouldn’t have come.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Because that’s what he wanted. He said he only took me so he could get you down here. Suddenly a HAND REACHES OUT FROM THE CLOTHES BEHIND LUCAS .--jerks him backward.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane grabs for Lucas... misses... Lucas is gone. Dane pushes through the clothes after him. And the closet seems to go on forever... LUCAS’ CRIES leading Dane throu this endless dark passage... .+-until Dane finally SLAMS INTO THE BACK WALL... and the is no Lucas. DANE (cont’d) (pounding the wall)

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane spins... races back toward the closet door... reache it... throws it open.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The closet door swings open, and Dane charges out... free because this isn’t where he should be.  94.

dialogues.speaker: BOY'S VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Don’t tell him where we are. Dane turns to the voice... the SHOWER CURTAIN PULLED ACRO THE OLD TUB.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Lucas. Dane pulls the shower curtain open... .+-and there’s the YOUNG DANE, crouched in the tub, holdi the BABY LUCAS in his arms.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG DANE
dialogues.text: Please. Dane just stares at his younger self.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You don’t have to be scared of him. He can’t hurt you anymore. THEN A BANGING ON THE DOOR BEHIND DANE... .--he spins to it. FATHER’S VOICE (0.S.)

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Leave them alone!

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Mom! Dane throws open the door... rushes into the darkness...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: .»+-and Dane comes tumbling out of the black hole in the kitchen... SLAMS TO THE FLOOR... .--he’s right back where he started.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: No! Dane scrambles toward the living room door.  95. DANE (cont’d) Lucas!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane charges through the door... into the living room... slides to a stop... because there’s the Man... DANE’S FATHER... sitting on the couch... his arm DRAPED OVER LUC SHOULDERS. Tears slip down Lucas’ cheeks.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Let him go. Dane’s Father just holds Lucas tighter. DANE (cont’d) You aren’t real. Their Father rises to his bare feet... and not only does look very real, he’s huge... must be close to seven feet tall. He rests a hand on Lucas’ head, and it’s nearly twi the size of Lucas’ skull. And there’s a GIANT GOLD RING o one of his MASSIVE FINGERS. And Lucas is scared... and so is Dane... and so are we. DANE (cont’d) You aren’t really here. You're still locked up. You can’t get to us. The Father gives Dane a frightening little smile... like knows something Dane doesn’t. DANE (cont’d) C’mon, Lucas. He can’t hurt us anymore. Lucas is afraid to move. DANE (cont’d) Now, Lucas. Lucas starts easing out from under the massive hand. And we're expecting it to suddenly clamp down... grab a fistf of hair... but it doesn’t... it lets Lucas go. Lucas takes off to Dane... wraps his arms around his wais DANE (cont’d) It’s okay. We’re going home now.  96. Dane takes Lucas’ hand... they back their way toward the kitchen door, with their Father just watching them escape DANE (cont’d) And don’t try to come after me again. You’re just wasting your time. Dane reaches the door... pushes against it... but it does move. He looks back... sees the SIX DEADBOLT LOCKS SECURI IT SHUT. Their Father grins that evil grin of his... holds up a SE KEYS.

dialogues.speaker: FATHER
dialogues.text: They can keep things out... or keep things in. Dane shoves Lucas toward the hall.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Go! Lucas takes off with Dane right behind him. Their Father just LAUGHS at them as they run past.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An old washer and dryer with a row of cabinets beside the Dane and Lucas duck into the room... lock the door.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: He’s gonna get us.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: No he’s not. Dane throws open one of the cabinets... pulls Lucas down toward it. DANE (cont’d) He didn’t know about this one. Dane pushes Lucas inside the cabinet... follows after him their FATHER BEATS HIS FISTS AGAINST THE DOOR.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tight, dark and claustrophobic... Lucas and Dane squeezin their way down the tiny passage.  97.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I can’t make it.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Yes you can. Keep going.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: It’s too small.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Don’t stop, Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And the door flying open... their father fills the doorwa can barely squeeze through. He crouches down... sees the opening through the back of the cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: And he’s way too big, so he spins... charges back out of room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One of the kitchen cabinets swings open, and out crawls Lucas, with Dane right behind.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Get to the rope! Then the BANGING of their Father working the locks on the other side of the door. DANE (cont’d) Hurry, Lucas! Dane lifts Lucas... gives him a head start up that rope. DANE (cont’d) Get to the hole! Dane throws a frightened glance to the door as it SHAKES. those locks are coming off. Dane pulls the kitchen table over against the door, then runs back to Lucas... starts shoving him up. DANE (cont’d) You gotta go faster!  98.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I’m trying! Dane plants his hand on Lucas’ butt, shoving him up the rope... starts up beneath him... .+.jJust as the DOOR STARTS SWINGING IN AGAINST THE TABLE Lucas strains with each pull... slowly rising. Their Father leans his head through the crack of the door sees them making their escape. He BANGS HIS SHOULDER AGAI THE DOOR... shoving the table out of the way... .--he’s getting in.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I need you to go faster, Lucas. Please go faster. Lucas is trying... sweating each tug on the rope... squir upward toward that hole. And Dane’s just beneath him, as their Father scrambles ov the table... gets to the rope, and starts swinging it... trying to shake the boys down. But the boys keep climbing, so he starts up after them... taking big long pulls... gaining fast... ...the boys are never going to make it... .»+.-SO Dane RELEASES THE ROPE... drops straight down int their Father... sending them both crashing to the kitchen floor.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane! Their Father jumps up... starts up the rope after Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Go! I’1l be right behind you! Lucas can’t make himself rise into the hole just above hi head. Their Father continues up after him... until Dane grabs his leg... holds him back. DANE (cont’d)

dialogues.speaker: GO, LUCAS
dialogues.text: Lucas climbs higher... his head disappears into the hole. then his body... finally he’s gone.  99. And Dane’s Father releases the rope... drops down to the floor with a THUNDEROUS BANG... like a giant has just dro from the sky. Dane backs up against the refrigerator. His Father walks toward him, and Dane closes his eyes... turns away from h Father... just the way he used to when he was little. The Father eases up behind Dane... towers over him. And then... DANE (cont’d) (softly) I’m not scared of you. (beat) I’m not scared of you. The Father cocks his oversized head. Dane pulls something down from the refrigerator... stares at it, then turns to face his Father... forces himself to stare up into those black eyes. DANE (cont’d) I’m not scared of you. And then Dane’s Father ROARS... this cry that shakes the room... the cry of Dane’s childhood.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Dane flinches at the scream... wants to run... would have before... but not this time. Instead, he just looks down the PHOTOGRAPH from the refrigerator.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: You aren’t this big. You only looked like it because I was little. ANGLE ON THE PHOTOGRAPH... ++. a YOUNG DANE posing with HIS REAL FATHER... a VERY AVERAGE-LOOKING MAN. DANE (V.O.) (cont'd) That’s why you always came after us. Because you were mean... but you were scared of everyone else. Dane looks up from the picture... .--and the giant monster of a man is gone... replaced by FATHER FROM THE PHOTOGRAPH... average... slight...  100. smaller than Dane even... nothing like the monster Dane’s fears had created... except for those same mean eyes... ..-but now they’re filled with fear... like he’s the one this room that’s suddenly scared. And Dane smiles... and at the same time, tears fill his eyes... because he’s suddenly been set free. DANE (cont’d) You were the one that was weak and afraid. And now I know that. Dane turns his back on his Father... walks to the rope. DANE (cont’d) I would tell you to stay away from Lucas, but there’s no reason. Dane looks back... the kitchen’s empty... his Father's gone... his fear is gone. DANE (cont’d) You don’t exist. Then Dane starts climbing up the rope.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lucas and Julie kneel beside the hole... see Dane rising the black.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Dane! They help him crawl out. Julie slams the trap door shut, attaches one of the locks, while Lucas works the other... seals the trap door shut. As soon as Lucas is finished, he hugs Dane... hard.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Nice climbin’, Lucas.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: You okay?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Better. Julie stares at him, waiting for more... doesn’t get it, SO...  101.

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: I need more than that. What was down there?

dialogues.speaker: DANE LUCAS
dialogues.text: My father. Clowns. Dane looks at Lucas... what?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Didn’t you see them? It was like this giant, scary circus. There were clowns everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: All the clowns that kept chasing me.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Was that before we crawled into the kitchen? Now Lucas is looking at Dane like he’s crazy.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: What kitchen?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: Where the rope was... we were climbing up... I told you to go on. Lucas just stares at Dane a confused beat, then...

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: I didn’t see you down there. Dane looks back to the trap door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dane, Lucas and Julie stand in the front yard, staring ba at the house.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Whatta we do now?

dialogues.speaker: JULIE
dialogues.text: Come over to my place. We’ll figure it.  102. Dane nods... just as HEADLIGHTS WASH OVER THEM... they tu to Susan’s SUV pulling back into the driveway. She parks. climbs out.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What are you three doing out here so late?

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We were just... having trouble sleeping.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Maybe that’s because you’re standing in the driveway.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I thought you were going to be gone for a couple days?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Had to change my plans a little.

dialogues.speaker: LUCAS
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: You're going to think I’m crazy. But I had this dream... and it seemed so real... that I lost both of you. (hugs them both) And that’s my worst fear.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: I don’t think you have to worry about that anymore.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: What does that mean? The kids exchange a glance.

dialogues.speaker: DANE
dialogues.text: We should probably talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A For Sale sign stands in the yard. Susan’s SUV is parked the drive.  103.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Susan walks around the house with a REALTOR.

dialogues.speaker: REALTOR
dialogues.text: It’s only six years old. The nicest kitchen in town, and plenty of storage space for those growing boys. They stop at the window... look out into the backyard... Dane and Lucas playing basketball. Julie sits in the gras watching them. REALTOR (cont’d) Do you think they’d like to come inside and take a look for themselves?

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Let’s leave them out there.

dialogues.speaker: REALTOR
dialogues.text: Well they sure do look like they enjoy each other.

dialogues.speaker: SUSAN
dialogues.text: Yes they do. Susan and the realtor walk out of the frame, as we stay o the window... and Dane and Lucas laughing... playing... b brothers again. SUSAN (0.S.) (cont'd) Now you said this place doesn’t have a basement, right? FADE OUT.
